attribute.description: Indicates if Attribute Overrides are allowed when the system is booted in secure mode. The default is 0x0, where attribute overrides are not allowed. However, the SBE can read mailbox scratch register 3 bit 7 to set it to 0x1, meaning that attribute overrides are allowed. The SBE passes this information up to hostboot via the bootloader. 0x00 = Attribute Overrides are not allowed (default) 0x01 = Attribute Overrides are allowed

Returns whether to treat SBE as quiesced or not. When Hostboot goes through an SBE update (always during key transition, possibly during normal flow), it may attempt to quiesce the SBE. Whether or not this was successful, firmware should treat the SBE as if it had been quiesced (and inhibit attribute synchronization during shutdown, etc.)
Valid values (bool): 0x00: Do not assume SBE is quiesced !0x00: Assume SBE is quiesced
Used to tell ATTN code whether to chk MASTER(0) OR all PROCs(1) when the checkForIplAttns routine is called.
Used to tell ATTN code whether to check the OCMBs separately.
Used to tell ATTN code to poll the PRD_HWP_PLID for OCMB analysis.
Used to enable clearing of SPD on all present DIMMs. This attribute is set via attribute override.
The size of DIMM (in bytes) within the SPD. This a raw value, 512 = 512 bytes, 1024 = 1024 bytes or 1 kilobyte, etc. This is set programatically, not designed for a static value.

When this attribute is set, Hostboot will perform a read-back verification of the SBE images written to SEEPROM. HB will read out the images page-by-page after updating the SEEPROM, check that the binaries match the customized SBE image, and check that ECC is correct. If the binaries don't match or there is a unrecoverable ECC error, Hostboot will throw an error. Note that this greatly slows down the SBE update process.
This attribute is used when a given target could have different i2c device addresses depending on which manufacture's device we are using.
Indicates which istep we should execute the CXX testcases after, if CONFIG_EARLY_TESTCASES is set. Format: 0xMMmm, where MM=major step, mm=minor step, e.g. 6.9=0x0609.

Used to keep track of which EEPROM page the current I2C master bus is set to 0 = PAGE_ZERO 1 = PAGE_ONE 2 = UNKNOWN_PAGE Data Format: 4x16 array of uint16_t values. The first index indicates the engine number of the bus. The second index indicates the port number of the bus. The value in the array is the I2C bus speed used for that engine/port combination in KHz.

Whether, when a node attempts to extend a measurement to its primary TPM, it must attempt to mirror the same HW and SW log measurement into the primary TPM in every other node. This flag is only set when multiple nodes are coalesced during IPL and MPIPL. It is reset at the beginning of Hostboot's IPL.
0x00 = Do not attempt to mirror an attempted primary TPM measurement to the primary TPM in all other nodes. 0x01 = Attempt to mirror an attempted primary TPM measurement to the primary TPM in all other nodes.

This is an attribute override, that when set to 1, will force an ECC update for a record when the ECC data for that record fails the ECC validation. 0x00 = Do *not* force an ECC update if a record fails ECC validation 0x01 = Do force an ECC update if a record fails ECC validation
Set bits to indicate reason to force an SBE update at various places in the IPL. See SBE_UPDATE_TYPE enum for values.
Force a TPM to appear as not present for testing
The ccin number for a particular FRU target. This is a 4-byte non-null terminated ASCII string.
Mutex for FSI Master Operations
Mutex for FSI-based SCOM Operations
Firmware release version (e.g. "NH1010_009"), stored by error logs in the EH section. This value comes from the BMC in the FRU Record Table.
Firmware subsystem version (e.g. "b0921a2039.1010") stored by error logs in the EH section. This value comes from the BMC in the FRU Record Table.
Information needed to address GPIO device that corresponds to the Physical Presence Detect circuit

complexType.description: Structure to define the addessing for an I2C slave device.

field.name: i2cMasterPath
field.description: Entity path to the chip that contains the I2C master

field.name: port
field.description: Port from the I2C Master device. This is a 6-bit value.

field.name: devAddr
field.description: Device address on the I2C bus. This is a 7-bit value, but then shifted 1 bit left.

field.name: engine
field.description: I2C master engine. This is a 2-bit value.

field.name: windowOpenPin
field.description: Logical GPIO pin number used to open or close the physcial presence window

field.name: physicalPresencePin
field.description: Logical GPIO pin number used to determine if physical presence was asserted
Determines which of the N selectable buses the mux will connect to. OxFF indicates no mux present or N/A.
field.name: i2cMuxBusSelector

field.description: Entity path to the I2C mux for this device.
field.name: i2cMuxPath

attribute.description: Indicates the MCTP EID of HBRT
Indicates which logical nodes have a hostboot image.
Indicates that a chip has already been put into reset elsewhere such that the next reset request will be skipped.
Hostboot mutex for serializing certain tests
Host boot mutex for testing
Mutex to guard Node Comm register access
Host boot recursive mutex for testing
The next HB reserved memory section available to assign a new reserved memory range.
Describes if the processor's SBE's seeprom versions match or not 0x0 = MATCH 0x1 = MISMATCH
Whether TPM initialization was attempted or not 0x00 (false) = Did not attempt to initialize TPM 0x01 (true) = Attempted to initialize TPM
Pointer to TPM log manager
Mutex to guard TPM access

Bitmask used to decide whether or not to process INFORMATIONAL/RECOVERED error logs (i.e. send them to the BMC and save them to PNOR) and/or to display them on the console. The bitmask values are defined by the HIDDEN_ERRLOGS_ENABLE_FLAGS enumeration.
0x00 = Prevent INFORMATIONAL/RECOVERED error logs from being processed or displayed (absense of any bits set)
Otherwise, any combination of the following bits, when allowed:
0x01 = Process INFORMATIONAL error logs. 0x02 = Process RECOVERED error logs. 0x04 = Display INFORMATIONAL error logs 0x08 = Display RECOVERED error logs

enumerationType.description: Enumeration describing valid bitmask values used by the HIDDEN_ERRLOGS_ENABLEBLE attribute. ALLOW_ALL_LOGS and DISPLAY_ALL_LOGS are conveneience aggregations of multiple bits

attribute.description: Attribute to check if HCODE is loaded in HOMER
Virtual address where HOMER memory is mapped into. If value is zero, memory must be mapped into virtual space.
Mutex for I2C Master engine 0
Mutex for I2C Master engine 1
Mutex for I2C Master engine 2
Mutex for I2C Master engine 3
Mutex to protect page select operations for I2C Master engine 0
Mutex to protect page select operations for I2C Master engine 1
Mutex to protect page select operations for I2C Master engine 2
Mutex to protect page select operations for I2C Master engine 3
Used to force IBSCOM enabled for lab testing
Cached Virtual Address of Inband Scom memory space for this Chip
Global IPC Buffer Addresseses for each Node dimension: node number (0:7)

enumerationType.description: Enumeration defining the offsets into the IPMI_SENSORS array.

attribute.description: 1 = in Memory Preserving IPL mode. 0 = in normal IPL mode.
0 = is master node, 1 = is slave node

Indicates which Key Clear Requests are being made See KEY_CLEAR_REQUEST enum in attribute_types.xml for bit definition This attribute assumes the value of the shared attribute KEY_CLEAR_REQUEST so that the shared attribute can be cleared and synced with the FSP on istep 16.

This attribute keeps track if an error log has been committed for when Hostboot fails to retrieve the override WOF table for a specific processor target.
0x00 = An error log has NOT been committed for this fail 0x01 = An error log has been committed for this fail
Value of the master mailbox scratch regs at the beginning of the boot. Need to save these away since HB uses some of them for communication purposes.
Virtual memory address this device has been mapped to.
Actual MDRT count in Memory Preserving IPL mode.
Maximum voltage limit for the dynamic VID DDR3 VDDR voltage setpoint. In mV.
Maximum voltage limit for the dynamic VID DDR4 VDDR voltage setpoint. In mV.
Units: mV
Units: 1/Amps
Units: mV
Units: 1/Amps
Units: mV
Units: uV/DRAM
Physical address where OCC Common Area is placed in mainstore.
While in Secureboot, this value is set to 1 the first time attribute override is attempted and error logged.
The part number for a particular FRU target
Processor Dump Area Table's captured thread register state array address.
Processor Dump Area Table's captured thread register state array size.
Processor Dump Area Table's thread register entry size.
Processor Dump Area Table's thread entry format.
Designates if the Physical Presence Window was Asserted: 0 - Physiscal Presence was NOT Asserted 1 - Physical Presence was Asserted
Designates if the assertion of Physical Presence should be faked: 0 - Do NOT Fake Physical Presence 1 - Fake Physical Presence
Designates if this this IPL was due to a request to open the Physical Presence Window: 0 - This IPL was NOT due to a Request to Open Window 1 - This IPL was due to a Request to Open Window
Designates if there is a request to open the Physical Presence Window: 0 - No Request to Open Window (ie, do NOT open window) 1 - Request to Open Window
Physical address where SBE Architectued Dump Area is located (per Hostboot Instance). Set in istep 21 it is only used during MPIPLs to retrieve the the architected processor state (SPR/GPR)
Virtual address where SBE Communications are placed in mainstore. This area is used for SBE message passing and may contain an SBE command or the response to it from HBRT.
Error ID for log that indicates why the SBE is compromised. Compromised means that the PCR6 data was not matched. (0 = not compromised)
Virtual address where SBE FFDC is placed in mainstore.

Physical address of data area that will be used for SBE PSU operations within HBRT. This space will be part of the Hostboot reserved memory that gets allocated during IPL. Note this is shared among all procs since we do everything serially at runtime.
Cached Virtual Address of SBE PSU memory space
Boolean indicating whether SBE can accurately report when Hostboot intentionally halts it, or not.

enumerationType.description: Enumeration used in OR expression to indicate why to update SBE.

enumerator.description: See targetservicestart for details, if processor is swapped need to update SBE.
enumerator.name: BAR_MISMATCH

enumerator.description: See call_mss_freq for details, if new and old frequency changes need to update SBE.
enumerator.name: MSS_FREQ_CHANGE

enumerator.description: See call_mss_attr_update for details, if topology changes need to update SBE.
enumerator.name: TOPOLOGY_CHECKS

enumerator.description: See call_mss_attr_update for details, if HRMOR outside configured range need to update SBE.
enumerator.name: HRMOR_OUTSIDE_CONFIGURED_MEM

enumerator.description: See call_mss_attr_update for details, if fabric topology changes need to update SBE.
enumerator.name: FABRIC_EFF_TOPOLOGY

attribute.description: Mutex for SCAN operations
Mutex for SCOM operations on a given target
Mutex for Indirect SCOM read operation

enumerationType.description: Enumeration indicating the IPMI sensor name, which will be used by hostboot when determining the sensor number to return. The sensor name consists of one byte of sensor type plus one byte of sub-type, to differentiate similar sensors under the same target. Our implementaion uses the IPMI defined entity ID as the sub-type.

attribute.description: The serial number for a particular FRU target

Skip requiring that the mailbox scratch registers 1 and 2 on the boot processor's SBE match the Hostboot deconfiguration state in istep 7.5. If this value is nonzero, the check will be performed but a reconfig loop will not be requested if mismatches occur.
Keep track of the calls to Special Wakeup. Increment for each call to enable, decrement for each call to disable. Not thread-safe, used at runtime which is single-threaded.
Mutex for SPI Master engine 0
Mutex for SPI Master engine 1
Mutex for SPI Master engine 2
Mutex for SPI Master engine 3
Mutex for SPI Master engine 4
Mutex for SPI Master engine 5

Static portion of the absolute location code for the FRU associated with this target. In order to realize a complete absolute location code, the dynamically determined chassis location code must be prefixed to this value. If the value is NULL, then the nearest parent target with a non-NULL value of this attribute will hold the location code info.
Indicates TPM Model (or family) for a TPM Target 0x00 = Undetermined (reserved if actively detected in the future) 0x01 = Nuvoton 65x (default) 0x02 = Nuvoton 75x

enumerationType.description: Enumeration of possible roles a TPM can play within a node. A TPM has the primary role if it's connected to the acting master processor, otherwise it has the backup role. The values must be in sync with the HDAT defined values.

attribute.description: Whether the TPM is primary or backup within its parent node. It is dynamically computed during the boot.
Attribute storing VPD state information

field.name: pnorCacheValid
field.description: Set when this target's VPD data has been loaded from EEPROM into the PNOR.

field.name: pnorCacheValidRT
field.description: See pnorCacheValid. Allows runtime version to be set separately from common version.

field.name: disableWriteToPnorRT
field.description: Set to disable write-thru to PNOR at runtime

field.name: vpdCollectedRemotely
field.description: Describes if the VPD for this target that we wrote to cache was collected by another entity, such as the BMC, and provided to the Host. If set to 1 this will indicate to the code to assume the target is present and to not attempt to read the eeprom like we typically do for presence detection.

attribute.description: The selected WOF frequency uplift table.
Cached Virtual Address of Xscom memory space for this Chip
